settings.text_reviews: Welzo has high quality supplements that I can't find elsewhere with quick next day delivery!
settings.text_reviews2: Ordered at 1:30 and received the package by 11:00am the next day. Quick service - thanks.
settings.text_reviews3: I am quite specific about what supplements I take, happy that Welzo stocks them. Great service!
settings.benefit_text1: Welzo has supplied over 30,000 people with their orders in the last year alone!
settings.benefit_text2: Our selection of supplements have been tested for high levels of quality and purity.
settings.benefit_text3: Fast, securely delivered, tracked next-day United Kingdom delivery from £3.99. Or free when over £40.
settings.benefit_text4: Based on over 24,000+ reviews on Trustindex, Trustpilot and Google.

settings.title: Delivery
settings.text:
UK, Europe & Rest of the World Shipping Details:
Same day dispatch for orders placed by 2pm (Orders after 2pm dispatched next working day).

UK - Free delivery on this item
EU & International:

Standard delivery (4 – 21 days) starts from £4.
Courier delivery (3 – 7 days) starts from £15.
Express delivery (1 – 5 days) starts from £20.49.

settings.title: Cautions & Warnings
settings.text:
The information provided on the Welzo supplements website is intended for general informational purposes only. We strive to ensure that the content presented is accurate and reflects the latest in nutritional and health science.


Welzo does not take responsibility for any possible inaccuracies in the published information, nor can it be held liable for any direct, indirect, consequential, or incidental damages or any damages whatsoever, arising from the use or performance of this website or from any information, products, services, or materials obtained through this site.

settings.title: How does your subscription work?
settings.text: Free thyroxine also referred to as T4 . It works to speed up the metabolism and is one of the two hormones produced by the thyroid gland. This test will only look to identify free T4 which means the the thyroxine is unbound in the body. Only when excessive T4 is unbound does it symbolise an issue.
